com.pump.image.pixel

Interface PixelIterator

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BytePixelIterator, IndexedBytePixelIterator, IntPixelIterator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BmpDecoderIterator, BufferedImageIterator, ByteBGRAConverter, ByteBGRConverter, ErrorDiffusionImageQuantization.ErrorDiffusionIndexedBytePixelIterator, GenericImageSinglePassIterator, ImageQuantization.AbstractIndexedBytePixelIterator, IntARGBConverter, IntRGBConverter, NearestNeighborImageQuantization.NearestNeighborIndexedBytePixelIterator, PixelConverter, ReverseBytePixelIterator, ScalingIterator, ScalingIterator.ByteScalingIterator, ScalingIterator.IntScalingIterator

    public interface PixelIterator
    This iterates over an image, one row of pixels at a time.

    Note this interface is not complete by itself: the BytePixelIterator and the IntPixelIterator interfaces add the crucial next(array) method (where the array argument is expressed either in bytes or ints).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int TYPE_3BYTE_RGB
      This is used to reflect when 3 bytes are used for [red, green, blue] data.
      static int TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB
      This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [alpha, red, green, blue] data.
      static int TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB_PRE
      This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [alpha, red, green, blue] premultiplied data.
      static int TYPE_4BYTE_BGRA
      This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [blue, green, red, alpha] premultiplied data.

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE_3BYTE_RGB

        static final int TYPE_3BYTE_RGB
        This is used to reflect when 3 bytes are used for [red, green, blue] data. I'm very confused about BufferedImage.TYPE_3BYTE_BGR, which somtimes appears to really reflect [blue, green, red] (as I'd expect) and at other times reflects [red, green blue]. In these classes I hope to easily distinguish between BGR and RGB.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB

        static final int TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB
        This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [alpha, red, green, blue] data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB_PRE

        static final int TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB_PRE
        This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [alpha, red, green, blue] premultiplied data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_4BYTE_BGRA

        static final int TYPE_4BYTE_BGRA
        This is used to reflect when 4 bytes are used for [blue, green, red, alpha] premultiplied data.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        int getType()
        The format of this pixel iterator. This will probably be one of the BufferedImage type constants.

      • isOpaque

        boolean isOpaque()
        Returns true if this image is guaranteed to be an opaque image. This has to do with the pixel type of this image and not its content. (For example: an image with an alpha channel that happens to be opaque may still return false.)

      • getPixelSize

        int getPixelSize()
        The number of array elements used to store 1 pixel.

        So in TYPE_4BYTE_ARGB this will be 4, but in TYPE_INT_ARGB this will be 1.

        Returns:
        the number of array elements used to store 1 pixel.

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        Whether this iterator is finished or not
        Returns:
        true if there is no more pixel data to read.

      • isTopDown

        boolean isTopDown()
        Indicates whether this iterator returns rows in a top-to-bottom order or a bottom-to-top order

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of this image.
        Returns:
        the width of this image.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this image.
        Returns:
        the height of this image.

      • getMinimumArrayLength

        int getMinimumArrayLength()
        The minimum length an array should be that is used to retrieve a row of pixel data.

        When you call next(array) on this iterator, the array's length should at least be getMinimumArrayLength().

        (Note the next() method is not in this interface: it exists in the subinterfaces: BytePixelIterator and IntPixelIterator.

        You should not assume you know what this value is. For example: If an iterator is actually a 4-byte iterator that is reducing to a 3-byte format, then this value may be 4*getWidth() instead of the expected 3*getWidth(). Conversion and scaling is performed in the original array if possible to minimize overhead.

        Returns:
        The minimum length an array should be that is used to retrieve a row of pixel data.

      • skip

        void skip()
        Skips a row of pixel data.
